div.l: With good swerdes ⁊and bokelers be hir sides
Iohn knew the weye / hym nedith no gides
And at the mylne the sak a downe he laithe
Aleyn̄ spak furst / all heile Symond in faithe
How fares thy faire doughter and thy wyf
Aleyn̄ welcome qduod Symkyn / be my lif
And Iohn also how nowe what do ye here
Be god qduod John Symond nede ne nede hath no pere
Hym behoueth serue hym self þᵗat hath no swayn̄
Or elles he is a foole / as clerkes seyne
Oure manciple / I hope he wilbe dede
Swa werkes hym aye the wynges in his hede
And therfor I is I come / and eke Aleyn̄
To grynde oure corne and carie it home ageyn̄
I pray you spede vs hens in that ye maye
It shalbe doon / qduod Symkyn̄ be my faye
What will ye doo whil it is in hande
Be god right be thyn hoper will I stande
Qduod Iohn and se how gates / the corne goth yn
Yit sawe I nevir / be my Fader kyn̄
How that the hoper wagges tille and fra
Aleyn̄ seid Iohn wilt þᵘou swa
Than wille I be benethe be my crown̄
And se how gates / the mele come adown̄
In to the trough / that shalbe my disporte
Qduod Iohn in faithe I may be of youre soorte
I is as ille a meller as are ye
This miller smyled / of hir nycite
And thought all this is not doon bᵗut for a wile
They wene that noman̄ / maye them begile
